subject: Simple? questions about TestDecorator
msgSnippet: I m looking at the JUnit sources and when i came to TestDecorator, I saw that this class has two methods related to running the test. public void
messageBody:
I'm looking at the JUnit sources and when i came to TestDecorator, I
saw that this class has two methods related to running the test.

public void basicRun(TestResult result) {
fTest.run(result);
}
...
}
public void run(TestResult result) {
basicRun(result);
}

I can see that one can derive from this with one's own decorator and
add steps before/after the test run. My questions are...

Why are there two run methods and not just a run() method?

Why does run() just invoke basicRun()?


PCM (Paul Michali)
